This is why Iâ€™d argue Microsoft acquiring Activision Blizzard is proof that they have a deep understanding of the metrics of immersion & know how to â€œhackâ€ the attention graph.

Making this acquisition a calculated risk vs. a bold bet.

This is why Microsoft is great at Monopoly.

Whatâ€™s the one thing in common w/these individuals pursuing Web 3.0 endeavors?

Theyâ€™re focused on getting & retaining their core audience's attention.

Just like Microsoft is by monetizing their audience's LTV & attention through the communities they engage in.

â€œWhere the attention goes, the energy flows.â€

All kinds of energy is flowing in the Web 3.0 direction i.e. the president of @Unilever is moving on to pursue an investment fund focused on technology megatrends, and a former exec of YouTube Gaming is joining @polygonstudios. ğŸŒ

In the game of Monopoly the more space you snag early on, the wealthier you become over time.

Companies like Microsoft that are staking their claim in the metaverse early on (through acquisitions like this) are poising themselves to â€œwinâ€ in the long-run at the game of Monopoly.

Microsoftâ€™s CEO Satya Nadella seems to agree with my theory. The metaverse is about connecting w/humans in a digital first medium.

Their press release confirms they're excited to put players & creators first. Prioritizing safety/inclusion/accessibility.

https://t.co/1rlX2QnDtU
